ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you reason that it's because you have no bread? Don't you perceive yet, neither understand? Is your heart still hardened?

block.text: <<Nә üçün çörәyinizin yoxluğundan danışırsınız? Hәlә dәrk etmirsinizmi, başa düşmürsünüzmü? Niyә ürәyiniz inadkardır?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having eyes, don't you see? Having ears, don't you hear? Don't you remember?

block.text: Gözlәriniz ola-ola görmürsünüzmü? Qulaqlarınız ola-ola eşitmirsinizmi? Mәgәr yadınızdan çıxıb?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I broke the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?”

block.text: Mәn beş çörәyi beş min nәfәrin arasında bölüb paylayanda yemәk tikәlәrindәn neçә zәnbil doldurdunuz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Onlar dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Twelve.”

block.text: <<On iki>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When the seven loaves fed the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?”

block.text: <<Yeddi çörәyi dörd min nәfәrin arasında bölüb paylayanda çörәk tikәlәrindәn neçә sәbәt doldurdunuz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Onlar dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Seven.”

block.text: <<Yeddi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He asked them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't you understand, yet?”

block.text: <<Hәlә başa düşmәmisinizmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to him, and begged him to touch him.

block.text: Onlar Bet-Saydaya gәldilәr. Bәzi adamlar İsanın yanına bir kor adam gәtirdilәr vә İsa bu adama toxunsun deyә Ona yalvardılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took hold of the blind man by the hand, and brought him out of the village. When he had spit on his eyes, and laid his hands on him,

block.text: İsa korun әlindәn tutub kәnddәn kәnara apardı. Sonra onun gözlәrinә tüpürüb әllәrini onun üzәrinә qoydu vә soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you see anything?”

block.text: <<Bir şey görürsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He looked up, and said,

block.text: Kor yuxarı baxıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I see men but they look likes trees walking around.”

block.text: <<Adamlar görürәm, ağaclara oxşayır, amma yeriyirlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then again he laid his hands on his eyes. He looked intently, and was restored, and saw everyone clearly.

block.text: Onda İsa әllәrini yenidәn bu adamın gözlәrinin üstünә qoydu. Kor adam gözlәrini açıb baxdı. O şәfa tapdı vә hәr şeyi aydın görmәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent him away to his house, saying,

block.text: İsa onu evinә göndәrdi vә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't enter into the village, nor tell anyone in the village.”

block.text: <<Kәndә belә, girmә>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went out, with his disciples, into the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәri ilә birgә Filip Qeysәriyyәsinin kәndlәrinә tәrәf yollandı. Yolda şagirdlәrindәn soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who do men say that I am?”

block.text: <<Adamların dediyinә görә Mәn kimәm?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Şagirdlәri Ona belә cavab verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John the Baptizer, and others say Elijah, but others: one of the prophets.”

block.text: <<Bәzilәri Vәftizçi Yәhya, başqaları İlyas, digәrlәri isә deyirlәr ki, peyğәmbәrlәrdәn birisәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But who do you say that I am?”

block.text: <<Bәs siz nә deyirsiniz? Sizcә Mәn kimәm?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered,

block.text: Peter Ona cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are the Christ.”

block.text: <<Sәn Mәsihsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus commanded them, saying:

block.text: İsa belə onlara əmr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one about me.”

block.text: "Mənə heç bir deyin görək."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus began to teach them, saying:

block.text: İsa onlara tәlim öyrәtmәyә başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.”

block.text: <<Bәşәr Oğlu çox әzab çәkmәli, ağsaqqallar, başçı kahinlәr vә ilahiyyatçılar tәrәfindәn rәdd olunmalı, öldürülmәli vә üç gündәn sonra dirilmәlidir.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke to them openly. Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

block.text: İsa bu sözlәri aydın deyirdi. Peter isә Onu bir kәnara çәkib etiraz etmәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, turning around, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and said,

block.text: Amma İsa dönüb şagirdlәrinә baxdı vә Peterә etiraz etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get behind me, Satan! For you have in mind not the things of God, but the things of men.”

block.text: <<Çәkil qarşımdan, Şeytan! Sәn Allahın işlәri haqqında deyil, insan әmәllәri barәsindә fikirlәşirsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called the multitude to himself with his disciples, and said to them,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәri ilә birgә camaatı da yanına çağırıb belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever wants to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

block.text: <<Әgәr bir kәs Mәnim ardımca gәlmәk istәyirsә, özündәn imtina etsin vә çarmıxını götürüb ardımca gәlsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; and whoever will lose his life for my sake and the sake of the Good News will save it.

block.text: Kim canını xilas etmәk istәyirsә, onu itirәcәk, amma kim Mәnimlә Müjdә uğrunda canını itirirsә, onu xilas edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what does it profit a man, to gain the whole world, and forfeit his life?

block.text: İnsana bütün dünyanı qazanıb canını itirmәyinin nә xeyri var?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what will a man give in exchange for his life?

block.text: İnsan öz canının әvәzinә nә verә bilәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man also will be ashamed of him, when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”

block.text: Bu vәfasız vә günahkar nәsil arasında kim Mәndәn vә Mәnim sözlәrimdәn utanarsa, Bәşәr Oğlu da Atasının izzәti içindә müqәddәs mәlәklәrlә birgә gәlәndә o adamdan utanacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 9
He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste death until they see the Kingdom of God come with power.”

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: burada duranlardan bәzisi Allahın Padşahlığının qüdrәtli gәlişini görmәdәn ölmәyәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John, and brought them up onto a high mountain privately by themselves, and he was changed into another form in front of them.

block.text: Altı gündәn sonra İsa Özü ilә yalnız Peter, Yaqub vә Yәhyanı götürüb hündür bir dağa çıxdı. Onların qarşısında görünüşü dәyişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His clothing became glistening, exceedingly white, like snow, such as no launderer on earth can whiten them.

block.text: Onun libası göz qamaşdırıcı ağ rәng aldı. Yer üzündә heç bir paltar tәmizlәyәn onu belә ağ edә bilmәzdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Elijah and Moses appeared to them, and they were talking with Jesus.
Peter said to Jesus,

block.text: O an İlyas vә Musa onlara göründü. Onlar İsa ilә söhbәt edirdi.
Peter sözә başlayıb İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let's make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

block.text: <<Rabbi! Nә yaxşı ki biz buradayıq. Gәl üç çardaq quraq, biri Sәnin, biri Musa, biri dә İlyas üçün>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he didn't know what to say, for they were very afraid.

block.text: O bilmirdi ki, nә desin, çünki onları dәhşәt bürümüşdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud,

block.text: Bu zaman bir bulud onların üzәrinә kölgә saldı. Buluddan bir sәs gәldi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him.”

block.text: <<Bu Mәnim sevimli Oğlumdur, Ona qulaq asın!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Suddenly looking around, they saw no one with them any more, except Jesus only.

block.text: Birdәn әtrafa baxanda artıq yanlarında İsadan başqa kimsәni görmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were coming down from the mountain, he commanded them, saying:

block.text: Onlar aşağı dağ gəlirdilər kimi, o, deyə onlara əmr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one what you have seen until after the Son of Man has risen from the dead.”

block.text: "Heç kəs sizin nə Son Man qədər sonra kəfəni qalxıb görmüş bildirin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They kept this saying to themselves, and asked each other:

block.text: Onlar özləri özlərinə belə bir-birinə suallar saxlanılır:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does ‘Rising from the dead’ mean?”

block.text: "'Kəfəni göyə' nedemek?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him, saying,

block.text: Ondan soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

block.text: <<Elә isә niyә ilahiyyatçılar deyirlәr ki, әvvәlcә İlyas gәlmәlidir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Elijah indeed comes first, and restores all things. How is it written about the Son of Man, that he should suffer many things and be despised?

block.text: <<Düzdür, әvvәlcә İlyas gәlib hәr şeyi yoluna qoymalıdır. Bәs Bәşәr Oğlu barәsindә nә üçün yazılıb ki, O, çox әzab çәkib alçaldılmalıdır?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they have also done to him whatever they wanted to, even as it is written about him.”

block.text: Lakin sizә deyirәm: artıq İlyas gәldi vә haqqında yazıldığı kimi, nә istәdilәrsә, onun başına gәtirdilәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming to the disciples, he saw a great multitude around them, and scribes questioning them.

block.text: Onlar şagirdlәrin yanına gәlәndә böyük bir izdihamın toplaşdığını vә bir neçә ilahiyyatçının onlarla mübahisә etdiyini gördülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him greeted him.
He asked the scribes,

block.text: İsanı görәn kimi bütün izdihamı heyrәt bürüdü vә Onun qarşısına qaçıb salamladı.
İsa onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you asking them?”

block.text: <<Onlarla nә barәdә mübahisә edirsiniz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the multitude answered,

block.text: Camaat arasından biri Ona cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I brought to you my son, who has a mute spirit.

block.text: <<Müәllim! Mәn Sәnin yanına lallıq ruhuna tutulmuş oğlumu gәtirmişәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whenever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, and grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”

block.text: Ruh onu harada tutursa, yerә çırpır, uşağın ağzı köpüklәnir, dişlәrini qıcıdır vә qıclaşır. Şagirdlәrindәn xahiş etdim ki, bu ruhu qovsunlar, amma bacarmadılar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered him,

block.text: İsa isә cavabında onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to me.”

block.text: <<Ey imansız nәsil! Nә vaxta qәdәr sizinlә qalacağam? Nә vaxta qәdәr sizә dözәcәyәm? Uşağı yanıma gәtirin!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.

block.text: Uşağı Onun yanına gәtirdilәr vә İsanı görәn kimi ruh dәrhal uşağı sarsıtdı. Uşaq yerә yıxılıb yuvarlanırdı vә ağzından köpük daşırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus asked the boy's father,

block.text: İsa onun atasından soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How long has it been since this has come to him?”

block.text: <<Bu uşaq nә vaxtdan belә hala düşüb?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Uşağın atası dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “From childhood.
Often it has cast him both into the fire and into the water, to destroy him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us, and help us.”

block.text: <<Körpәlikdәn bәri.
Bu ruh onu hәlak etmәk üçün dәfәlәrlә oda vә suya atıb. Amma bacarırsansa, bizә kömәk et, bizә rәhmin gәlsin!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”

block.text: <<“Bacarırsansa” nә sözdür? İman edәn üçün hәr şey mümkündür!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears,

block.text: Uşağın atası dәrhal fәryad qopararaq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I believe. Help my unbelief!”

block.text: <<İman edirәm, kömәk et ki, imansızlığım yox olsun!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus saw that a multitude came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to him,

block.text: İsa camaatın qaçıb gәldiyini görәndә natәmiz ruha qadağan edib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and never enter him again!”

block.text: <<Ey lallıq vә karlıq ruhu, Mәn sәnә әmr edirәm, bu uşağın içindәn çıx vә bir daha ora girmә!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having cried out,
and convulsed greatly, it came out of him. The boy became like one dead; so much that most of them said,

block.text: Ruh çığırıb
uşağı sarsıdaraq çıxdı. Uşaq ölü kimi düşdü vә çoxları dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is dead.”

block.text: <<O öldü!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus took him by the hand, and raised him up; and he arose.

block.text: Lakin İsa uşağın әlindәn tutub qaldırdı vә o, ayağa qalxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come into the house, his disciples asked him privately,

block.text: İsa evә girәndәn sonra şagirdlәri tәklikdә Ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why couldn't we cast it out?”

block.text: <<Bәs nә üçün biz o ruhu qova bilmәdik?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This kind can come out by nothing, except by prayer and fasting.”

block.text: <<Bu cür ruhlar yalnız dua ilә çıxa bilәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out from there, and passed through Galilee. He didn't want anyone to know it.

block.text: Onlar oranı tәrk edib Qalileyadan keçirdi. İsa istәmirdi ki, kimsә bundan xәbәr tutsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he was teaching his disciples, and said to them,

block.text: Çünki şagirdlәrinә tәlim öyrәdirdi. Onlara belә deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man is being handed over to the hands of men, and they will kill him; and when he is killed, on the third day he will rise again.”

block.text: <<Bәşәr Oğlu insan әllәrinә tәslim edilәcәk vә Onu öldürәcәklәr. Öldürüldükdәn üç gün sonra O dirilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they didn't understand the saying, and were afraid to ask him.

block.text: Lakin şagirdlәr bu sözü başa düşmәdilәr vә Ondan soruşmaqdan da qorxurdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to Capernaum, and when he was in the house he asked them,

block.text: Onlar Kefernahuma gәldilәr. İsa evdә olanda şagirdlәrdәn soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What were you arguing among yourselves on the way?”

block.text: <<Yol boyu nә barәdә mübahisә edirdiniz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were silent, for they had disputed one with another on the way about who was the greatest.

block.text: Heç kim dillәnmәdi, çünki yol boyu öz aralarında kimin әn böyük olması barәdә mübahisә etmişdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sat down, and called the twelve; and he said to them,

block.text: İsa oturub On İki şagirdi yanına çağıraraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If any man wants to be first, he shall be last of all, and servant of all.”

block.text: <<Әgәr bir kәs birinci olmaq istәyirsә, hamıdan axırıncı vә hamının xidmәtçisi olsun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took a little child, and set him in their midst. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,

block.text: O bir balaca uşağı götürüb şagirdlәrin arasına qoydu vә sonra uşağı qucağına alıb onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever receives one such little child in my name, receives me, and whoever receives me, doesn't receive me, but him who sent me.”

block.text: <<Kim Mәnim adımla belә uşaqlardan birini qәbul edәrsә, Mәni qәbul edәr. Kim Mәni qәbul edәrsә, Mәni yox, Mәni Göndәrәni qәbul edәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John said to him,

block.text: Yәhya Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we saw someone who doesn't follow us casting out demons in your name; and we forbade him, because he doesn't follow us.”

block.text: <<Müәllim, biz Sәnin adınla cinlәri qovan bir nәfәri gördük, amma bizim ardımızca gәlmәdiyinә görә ona mane olduq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't forbid him, for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name, and be able quickly to speak evil of me.

block.text: <<Ona mane olmayın! Elә bir adam yoxdur ki, Mәnim adımla möcüzә göstәrsin vә sonra Mәni pislәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever is not against us is on our side.

block.text: Çünki әleyhimizә olmayan bizim tәrәfimizdәdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever will give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because you are Christ's, most certainly I tell you, he will in no way lose his reward.

block.text: Mәsihә mәxsus olduğunuz üçün kim sizә bir kasa su içirdәrsә, sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: mükafatsız qalmayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever will cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if he were thrown into the sea with a millstone hung around his neck.

block.text: Kim Mәnә iman edәn bu kiçiklәrdәn birini pis yola çәkәrsә, öz boynuna böyük bir dәyirman daşı asıb dәnizә atılmaq onun üçün daha yaxşı olar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, rather than having your two hands to go into Gehenna, into the unquenchable fire,

block.text: Әgәr әlin sәni pis yola çәkәrsә, onu kәs. Sәnin әbәdi hәyata şikәst olaraq daxil olmağın iki әllә cәhәnnәmә, sönmәz oda düşmәyindәn yaxşıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘where their worm doesn't die, and the fire is not quenched.’

block.text: 'oradakıları gәmirәn qurd ölmür vә oranın yanar odu sönmür.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame, rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna, into the fire that will never be quenched--

block.text: Әgәr ayağın sәni pis yola çәkәrsә, onu kәs. Sәnin әbәdi hәyata topal olaraq daxil olmağın iki ayaqla cәhәnnәmә atılmağından yaxşıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘where their worm doesn't die, and the fire is not quenched.’

block.text: 'oradakıları gәmirәn qurd ölmür vә oranın yanar odu sönmür.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your eye causes you to sin, cast it out. It is better for you to enter into the Kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire,

block.text: Әgәr gözün sәni pis yola çәkәrsә, onu çıxart. Sәnin tәk gözlә Allahın Padşahlığına daxil olmağın iki gözlә cәhәnnәmә atılmağından yaxşıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘where their worm doesn't die, and the fire is not quenched.’

block.text: Oradakıları gәmirәn qurd ölmür vә oranın yanar odu sönmür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.

block.text: Çünki hamı odla duzlanacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, with what will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”

block.text: Duz yaxşı şeydir, amma әgәr duz dadsız olarsa, ona nә ilә dad vermәk olar? Qoy sizdә duz vә aranızda da sülh olsun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 10
He arose from there and came into the borders of Judea and beyond the Jordan. Multitudes came together to him again. As he usually did, he was again teaching them.

block.text: İsa oradan ayrılıb Yәhudeya bölgәsinә vә İordan çayının o biri tayına getdi. Yenә çoxlu adam Onun başına yığıldı vә O, adәtinә görә yenidәn tәlim öyrәtmәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pharisees came to him testing him, and asked him,

block.text: Bәzi fariseylәr İsanın yanına gәlib Onu sınamaq üçün belә bir sual verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”

block.text: <<Kişinin öz arvadını boşamağa icazәsi varmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: İsa onlara cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did Moses command you?”

block.text: <<Musa sizә nә әmr etdi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Moses allowed a certificate of divorce to be written, and to divorce her.”

block.text: <<Musa kişiyә talaq kağızını yazıb arvadını boşamağa icazә verdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa da onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For your hardness of heart, he wrote you this commandment.

block.text: <<O bu әmri ürәyinizin inadkar olduğuna görә yazdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But from the beginning of the creation, God made them male and female.

block.text: Allah yaradılışın başlanğıcından “Onları kişi vә qadın olaraq yaratdı”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will join to his wife,

block.text: “Buna görә dә kişi ata-anasını tәrk edib arvadına qovuşacaq

ReferenceBlocks.text: and the two will become one flesh, so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.

block.text: vә ikisi bir bәdәn olacaq”. Artıq onlar iki deyil, bir bәdәndir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.”

block.text: Buna görә dә qoy Allahın birlәşdirdiyini insan ayırmasın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the house, his disciples asked him again about the same matter.
He said to them,

block.text: Onlar evdә olarkәn şagirdlәr İsaya bu barәdә yenә sual verdilәr.
İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery against her.

block.text: <<Arvadını boşayıb başqası ilә evlәnәn kәs arvadına münasibәtdә zina edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a woman herself divorces her husband, and marries another, she commits adultery.”

block.text: Әrindәn boşanıb başqasına gedәn qadın da zina edir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were bringing to him little children so that he would touch them, but the disciples rebuked those who were bringing them, saying:

block.text: Adamlar uşaqları İsanın yanına gәtirirdilәr ki, İsa onlara toxunsun. Şagirdlәr isә onlara qadağan etdilәr, dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't bother the teacher!”

block.text: "Müəllim üzen etmə!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said to them,

block.text: Bunu görәn İsa acıqlanaraq onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow the little children to come to me! Don't forbid them, for the Kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

block.text: <<Uşaqları buraxın, qoy Mәnim yanıma gәlsinlәr! Onlara mane olmayın! Çünki Allahın Padşahlığı belәlәrinә mәxsusdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, whoever will not receive the Kingdom of God like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: kim Allahın Padşahlığını bir uşaq kimi qәbul etmәsә, oraya әsla daxil ola bilmәz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands on them.

block.text: Sonra uşaqları qucaqlayıb әllәrini onların üzәrinә qoydu vә xeyir-dua verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him,

block.text: İsa yola çıxarkәn bir nәfәr qaça-qaça Onun yanına gәldi. Onun qarşısında diz çökәrәk soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?”

block.text: <<Ey yaxşı Müәllim, mәn nә etmәliyәm ki, әbәdi hәyatı irs olaraq alım?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one--God.

block.text: <<Mәnә niyә yaxşı deyirsәn? Tәk Allahdan başqa yaxşısı yoxdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder,’ ‘Do not commit adultery,’ ‘Do not steal,’ ‘Do not give false testimony,’ ‘Do not defraud,’ ‘Honor your father and mother.’”

block.text: Onun әmrlәrini bilirsәn: “Qәtl etmә. Zina etmә. Oğurluq etmә. Yalandan şahidlik etmә. Kimisә aldatma. Ata-anana hörmәt et”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Bu adam isә İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I have observed all these things from my youth.”

block.text: <<Müәllim, bunların hamısına gәncliyimdәn bәri riayәt edirәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus looking at him loved him, and said to him,

block.text: İsa ona mәhәbbәtlә baxaraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “One thing you lack. Go, sell whatever you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me, taking up the cross.”

block.text: <<Sәnin bir şeyin çatışmır: get nәyin varsa, satıb yoxsullara payla. Onda göydә xәzinәn olacaq. Sonra qayıt, Mәnim ardımca gәl>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.

block.text: Bunu eşidәn adam pәrt oldu. Kәdәrlәnib getdi, çünki var-dövlәti çox idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples,

block.text: İsa әtrafındakılara baxdı vә şagirdlәrinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!”

block.text: <<Var-dövlәti olanların Allahın Padşahlığına daxil olması nә qәdәr çәtindir!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answered again,

block.text: Onun sözlәrindәn şagirdlәri heyrәt bürüdü. Amma İsa yenә onlara cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Children, how hard is it for those who trust in riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

block.text: <<Övladlarım, Allahın Padşahlığına daxil olmaq nә qәdәr çәtindir!

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Dәvәnin iynә gözündәn keçmәsi varlı adamın Allahın Padşahlığına daxil olmasından asandır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were exceedingly astonished, saying to him,

block.text: Onlar daha da tәәccüblәnәrәk bir-birlәrinә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then who can be saved?”

block.text: <<Elә isә, kim xilas ola bilәr?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, looking at them, said,

block.text: İsa onlara baxıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “With men it is impossible, but not with God, for all things are possible with God.”

block.text: <<Bu, insanlar üçün qeyri-mümkündür, amma Allah üçün yox. Çünki Allah üçün hәr şey mümkündür>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter began to tell him,

block.text: Peter Ona belә demәyә başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we have left all, and have followed you.”

block.text: <<Bax biz hәr şeyi qoyub Sәnin ardınca gәlmişik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said,

block.text: İsa cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or land, for my sake, and for the sake of the Good News,

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: Mәnimlә Müjdә uğrunda ya evini ya qardaşlarını ya bacılarını ya anasını ya atasını ya uşaqlarını vә yaxud tarlalarını atan elә bir kәs yoxdur ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he will receive one hundred times more now in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, with persecutions; and in the age to come eternal life.

block.text: indi bu dövrdә çәkdiyi әzab-әziyyәtlә birgә bundan yüz qat artıq evlәr, qardaşlar, bacılar, analar, uşaqlar, tarlalar, gәlәcәk dövrdә isә әbәdi hәyat almasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But many who are first will be last; and the last first.”

block.text: Amma birinci olanların çoxu axırıncı, axırıncı olanlar isә birinci olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going in front of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid. He again took the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him, saying:

block.text: Onlar yola çıxıb Yerusәlimә gedirdilәr. İsa onların qabağında gedirdi. Şagirdlәri isә heyrәt bürümüşdü, Onun ardınca gәlәnlәr qorxu içindә idi. İsa On İki şagirdi yenә bir tәrәfә çәkib başına gәlәcәk hadisәlәr barәdә danışmağa başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.

block.text: <<Bax Yerusәlimә qalxırıq, Bәşәr Oğlu başçı kahinlәrә vә ilahiyyatçılara tәslim olunacaq. Onu ölümә mәhkum edib başqa millәtlәrә tәslim edәcәklәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will mock him, spit on him, scourge him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.”

block.text: Onlar Bәşәr Oğlunu әlә salacaq, Ona tüpürәcәk vә qamçılayıb öldürәcәklәr. O, üç gündәn sonra dirilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came near to him, saying,

block.text: Zavdayın oğulları Yaqub vә Yәhya Ona yaxınlaşıb dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we will ask.”

block.text: <<Müәllim, istәyirik ki, dilәdiyimizi bizim üçün edәsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do for you?”

block.text: <<Nә istәyirsiniz, sizin üçün edim?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Onlar İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Grant to us that we may sit, one at your right hand, and one at your left hand, in your glory.”

block.text: <<Sәn izzәtlәnәndә qoy birimiz sağında, o birimiz solunda oturaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Amma İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You don't know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”

block.text: <<Nә dilәdiyinizi özünüz dә bilmirsiniz. Mәnim içdiyim kasadan siz dә içә bilәrsinizmi? Mәnim vәftiz olduğum kimi siz dә vәftiz ola bilәrsinizmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Onlar dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We are able.”

block.text: <<Bilәrik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with.

block.text: <<Mәnim içdiyim kasadan siz dә içәcәksiniz, Mәnim vәftiz olduğum kimi siz dә vәftiz olacaqsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared.”

block.text: Amma sağımda vә yaxud solumda oturmağa izin vermәk Mәndәn asılı deyil. Ora kimlәr üçün hazırlanıbsa, onlara verilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant towards James and John.

block.text: Bunu eşidәn on şagirdin Yaqubla Yәhyaya acığı tutmağa başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus summoned them, and said to them,

block.text: Onda İsa şagirdlәri yanına çağırıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You know that they who are recognized as rulers over the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

block.text: <<Bilirsiniz ki, millәtlәrin rәhbәri sayılanlar onların üzәrindә hökmranlıq, әyanları da onlara ağalıq edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it shall not be so among you, but whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant.

block.text: Sizin aranızda isә qoy belә olmasın. Sizlәrdәn böyük olmaq istәyәn xidmәtçiniz olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever of you wants to become first among you, shall be bondservant of all.

block.text: Aranızda birinci olmaq istәyәn hamının qulu olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man also came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

block.text: Çünki Bәşәr Oğlu gәlmәdi ki, Ona xidmәt etsinlәr, gәldi ki, Özü xidmәt etsin vә çoxlarını satın almaq üçün Öz canını fidyә versin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.

block.text: Sonra onlar Yerixoya gәldilәr. İsa şagirdlәri ilә birgә böyük izdihamla Yerixodan çıxanda Timay oğlu Bartimay adlı bir kor dilәnçi yol kәnarında oturmuşdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say,

block.text: Nazaretli İsanın orada olduğunu eşitdikdә deyә bağırmağa başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus, son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: <<Ey Davud Oğlu İsa! Mәnә rәhm elә!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many rebuked him, saying:

block.text: Bir çox belə ona töhmətlənmək:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet!”

block.text: "Sakit olun!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he cried out even more,

block.text: Lakin o, daha öncə

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: <<Ey Davud Oğlu! Mәnә rәhm elә!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus stood still, and said,

block.text: İsa dayanıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Call him.”

block.text: <<Onu çağırın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They called the blind man, saying to him,

block.text: Onlar bu kor adamı çağıraraq dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!”

block.text: <<Cәsarәtli ol, qalx, O sәni çağırır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He, casting away his cloak, sprang up, and came to Jesus.
Jesus asked him,

block.text: O, üst paltarını üstündәn atdı vә yerindәn sıçrayaraq İsanın yanına gәldi.
İsa ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do for you?”

block.text: <<Nә istәyirsәn, sәnin üçün edim?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The blind man said to him,

block.text: Kor adam Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, that I may see again.”

block.text: <<Rabbuni, gözlәrim açılsın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.”

block.text: <<Get, imanın sәni xilas etdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

block.text: Hәmin an bu adamın gözlәri açıldı vә o da İsanın ardınca getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 11
When they drew near to Jerusalem, to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
and said to them,

block.text: Onlar Yerusәlimә yaxınlaşarkәn Zeytun dağının yamacındakı Bet-Faqe ilә Bet-Anyaya gәldiklәri zaman İsa şagirdlәrindәn ikisini göndәrәrәk
onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way into the village that is opposite you. Immediately as you enter into it, you will find a young donkey tied, on which no one has sat. Untie him, and bring him.

block.text: <<Qarşınızdakı kәndә gedin. Oraya girәn kimi hәlә heç kәsin minmәdiyi, bağlanmış bir sıpa tapacaqsınız. Onu açıb buraya gәtirin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs him;’ and immediately he will send him back here.”

block.text: Kim sizdәn soruşsa: “Bunu nә üçün edirsiniz?”, ona “bu sıpa Rәbbә lazımdır, tezliklә yerinә qaytaracaq” deyin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went away, and found a young donkey tied at the door outside in the open street, and they untied him.

block.text: Onlar getdilәr. Küçәdә bir evin qapısının kәnarına bağlanmış sıpa tapıb onu açdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of those who stood there asked them,

block.text: Orada duran bәzi adamlar onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you doing, untying the young donkey?”

block.text: <<Nә edirsiniz? Bu sıpanı nә üçün açırsınız?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to them:

block.text: Onlar onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord needs him.”

block.text: "The Rəbbi ona lazımdır."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The people told them:

block.text: Insanlar onlara dedim:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You may go.”

block.text: "Siz getmək bilər."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought the young donkey to Jesus, and threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it.

block.text: Onlar sıpanı İsanın yanına gәtirdilәr vә öz paltarlarını sıpanın üstünә sәrdilәr. İsa sıpanın belinә mindi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many spread their garments on the way, and others were cutting down branches from the trees, and spreading them on the road.

block.text: Bir çoxu paltarlarını, bәzisi dә әtrafdakı ağaclardan kәsdiklәri budaqları yola döşәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who went in front, and those who followed, cried out,

block.text: İsanın önündә gedәnlәr vә ardınca gәlәnlәr belә nida edirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!

block.text: <<Hosanna! Rәbbin ismi ilә Gәlәnә alqış olsun!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

block.text: Atamız Davudun gәlәn Padşahlığı xeyir-dualı olsun! Әn ucalarda hosanna!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.

block.text: İsa Yerusәlimә daxil olub mәbәdә girdi. O hәr şeyә nәzәr saldı. Sonra On İki şagirdlә bәrabәr Bet-Anyaya getdi, çünki artıq gec idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry.

block.text: Ertәsi gün onlar Bet-Anyadan çıxdılar. O zaman İsa acmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came to see if perhaps he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
Jesus told it,

block.text: Uzaqda yarpaqlı bir әncir ağacı gördü vә ağaca yaxınlaşdı ki, bәlkә onda meyvә tapar. Amma onun yanına gәlәndә ağacda yarpaqdan başqa bir şey tapmadı, çünki әncirin bar mövsümü deyildi.
Onda İsa ağaca dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!”

block.text: <<Qoy sәndәn bir daha heç kәs meyvә yemәsin!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and his disciples heard it.

block.text: Bunu şagirdlәri dә eşitdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to Jerusalem, and Jesus entered into the temple, and began to throw out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money changers, and the seats of those who sold the doves.

block.text: Onlar Yerusәlimә gәldilәr. İsa mәbәdә girib orada alver edәnlәri qovmağa başladı. Sәrrafların masalarını vә göyәrçin satanların kürsülәrini çevirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He would not allow anyone to carry a container through the temple.

block.text: Heç kimi yük daşıyaraq mәbәd hәyәtlәrindәn keçmәyә qoymadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He taught, saying to them,

block.text: Onlara tәlim öyrәdәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't it written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations?’ But you have made it a den of robbers!”

block.text: <<Mәgәr yazılmayıb ki, “Mәnim evim bütün xalqlar üçün Dua evi adlandırılacaq”? Amma siz onu “quldur yuvasına” çevirmisiniz!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.

block.text: Bunu eşidәn başçı kahinlәr vә ilahiyyatçılar İsanı öldürmәk üçün yol axtarırdılar. Çünki bütün xalq Onun tәliminә tәәccüblәndiyi üçün Ondan qorxurdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening came, he went out of the city.

block.text: Axşam olanda İsa vә şagirdlәri şәhәrdәn kәnara çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.

block.text: Sәhәr erkәn onlar әncir ağacının yanından keçәndә gördülәr ki, ağac kökündәn quruyub.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter, remembering, said to him,

block.text: Hadisәni xatırlayan Peter İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.”

block.text: <<Rabbi, bax lәnәtlәdiyin әncir ağacı quruyub>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa cavab verib onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have faith in God.

For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and doesn't doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening; he shall have whatever he says.

block.text: <<Allaha imanınız olsun.
Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: kim bu dağa “Qalx, dәnizә atıl!” deyәrsә vә ürәyindә şübhә etmәdәn dediyinin olacağına inanarsa, onun üçün edilәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.

block.text: Buna görә sizә deyirәm: dua edib hәr nә dilәsәniz, inanın ki, artıq almısınız vә istәdiyiniz sizin üçün edilәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive them so that your Father who is in heaven may also forgive you your transgressions.

block.text: Durub dua edәndә kimdәn narazılığınız varsa, bağışlayın ki, göylәrdә olan Atanız da tәqsirlәrinizi bağışlasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.”

block.text: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders came to him,
and they began saying to him,

block.text: Onlar yenә Yerusәlimә gәldilәr. İsa mәbәddә gәzәn zaman başçı kahinlәr, ilahiyyatçılar vә ağsaqqallar Ona yaxınlaşıb
dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “By what authority do you do these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”

block.text: <<Sәn bu işlәri hansı sәlahiyyәtlә edirsәn? Bu işlәri görmәk üçün Sәnә bu sәlahiyyәti kim verib?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

block.text: <<Mәn dә sizә bir sual verәcәyәm; ona cavab versәniz, Mәn dә bunları hansı sәlahiyyәtlә etdiyimi sizә deyәrәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The baptism of John--was it from heaven, or from men? Answer me.”

block.text: Yәhyanın vәftizi göydәn idimi, yoxsa insanlardan? Mәnә cavab verin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying,

block.text: Onlar isә aralarında müzakirә edәrәk belә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If we should say, ‘From heaven’; he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

block.text: <<Әgәr desәk “göydәn”, “Bәs nә üçün ona inanmadınız?” deyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If we should say, ‘From men’”

block.text: Amma desәk “insanlardan”?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: --they feared the people because they believed that John really was a prophet.
They answered Jesus,

block.text: O zaman xalqdan qorxurdular, çünki hamı Yәhyanı hәqiqi peyğәmbәr sayırdı.
Cavabında İsaya dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We don't know.”

block.text: <<Bilmirik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa da onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

block.text: <<Bunları hansı sәlahiyyәtlә etdiyimi Mәn dә sizә demirәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 12
He began to speak to them in parables.

block.text: İsa mәsәllәr söylәyib onlarla danışmağa başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A man planted a vineyard, put a hedge around it, dug a pit for the winepress, built a tower, rented it out to a farmer, and went into another country.

block.text: <<Bir adam üzüm bağı saldı, oranın әtrafına çәpәr çәkdi. İçindә yer qazaraq üzümsıxan düzәltdi, nәzarәt qüllәsi tikdi. Sonra isә bağı bağbanlara icarәyә verәrәk başqa ölkәyә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was time, he sent a servant to the farmer to get from the farmer his share of the fruit of the vineyard.

block.text: Mәhsul vaxtı çatanda bağbanların yanına bir qul göndәrdi ki, üzüm bağının mәhsulundan bir qәdәrini onlardan alsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took him, beat him, and sent him away empty.

block.text: Lakin bağbanlar qulu tutub döydülәr vә әliboş geri qaytardılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, he sent another servant to them; and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.

block.text: Bağ sahibi onların yanına yenә başqa bir qul göndәrdi. Onun da başını vurub yardılar vә biabır etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he sent another; and they killed him; and many others, beating some, and killing some.

block.text: Başqasını göndәrdi, onu isә öldürdülәr. O, çox adam göndәrdi, onlardan bәzisini döydülәr, bәzisini isә öldürdülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore still having one, his beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

block.text: Yanında ancaq bir nәfәr qalmışdı ki, bu da onun sevimli oğlu idi. “Oğluma hörmәt edәrlәr” deyәrәk axırda onu onların yanına göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But those farmers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let's kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’

block.text: Bağbanlar isә bir-birlәrinә dedilәr: “Varis budur. Gәlin onu öldürәk, onda miras bizә qalacaq”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took him, killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.

block.text: Belәcә onu tutub öldürdülәr vә bağdan kәnara atdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.

block.text: Belәliklә, bağ sahibi nә edәcәk? Gәlib bağbanları hәlak edәcәk vә bağı başqalarına verәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Haven't you even read this Scripture: ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner.

block.text: Mәgәr siz bu Müqәddәs Yazını oxumamısınız? “Bәnnaların rәdd etdiyi daş Guşәdaşı olub.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was from the Lord, it is marvelous in our eyes’?”

block.text: Bu, Rәbbin işi idi, Gözümüzdә xariqәli bir işdir”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They tried to seize him, but they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spoke the parable against them. They left him, and went away.

block.text: Yәhudi rәhbәrlәri başa düşdülәr ki, İsa bu mәsәli onlar barәdә söylәdi. Ona görә dә İsanı tutmaq üçün yol axtarırdılar, lakin camaatdan qorxdular. Belәcә Onu tәrk edib getdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sent some of the Pharisees and of the Herodians to him, that they might trap him with words.

block.text: Sonra İsanı dediyi sözlәrlә tәlәyә salmaq üçün fariseylәrdәn vә hirodçulardan bәzisini Onun yanına göndәrdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come, they asked him,

block.text: Onlar gәlib İsaya dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and don't defer to anyone; for you aren't partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
Shall we give, or shall we not give?”

block.text: <<Müәllim, biz bilirik ki, Sәn etibarlı adamsan vә heç kimә tәrәfkeşlik etmirsәn. Çünki insanlar arasında fәrq qoymursan vә Allahın yolunu hәqiqәtә görә öyrәdirsәn. Bizim üçün qeysәrә vergi vermәyә icazә var ya yox?
Biz vergi verәk ya yox?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them,

block.text: Onların ikiüzlülüyünü bilәn İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you test me? Bring me a denarius, that I may see it.”

block.text: <<Mәni niyә sınağa çәkirsiniz? Mәnә bir dinar gәtirin, baxım>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought it. He said to them,

block.text: Onlar da gәtirdilәr. İsa soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whose is this image and inscription?”

block.text: <<Sikkәnin üstündәki bu tәsvir vә yazı kimindir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Ona dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Caesar's.”

block.text: <<Qeysәrin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.”

block.text: <<Elә isә, qeysәrin haqqını qeysәrә, Allahın haqqını Allaha verin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They marveled greatly at him.

block.text: Onlar İsanın sözlәrinә heyrәtlәndilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There came to him Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection. They asked him, saying,

block.text: Dirilmәnin olmadığını iddia edәn bәzi sadukeylәr İsanın yanına gәlib soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us, ‘If a man's brother dies, and leaves a wife behind him, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up offspring for his brother.’

block.text: <<Müәllim, Musa bizim üçün belә yazmışdır: “Әgәr bir adamın qardaşı ölsә, arvadı dul qalsa, amma övladı olmazsa, o biri qardaş bu dul arvadı alıb ölәn qardaşın nәslini davam etdirsin”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying left no offspring.

block.text: Yeddi qardaş var idi. Birincisi bir arvad aldı, amma övladı olmadan öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The second took her, and died, leaving no children behind him. The third likewise;

block.text: Bu arvadı ikinci qardaş aldı, o da özündәn sonra övlad qoymadan öldü, üçüncüsü dә,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and the seven took her and left no children. Last of all the woman also died.

block.text: hәtta yeddincisinә qәdәr belә etdi, amma övladı olmadan öldü. Hamısından sonra bu qadın da öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be of them? For the seven had her as a wife.”

block.text: Qiyamәt günündә, ölülәr dirilәndә bu qadın onlardan hansının arvadı olacaq? Çünki yeddi qardaşın yeddisi dә bu qadını almışdı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't this because you are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God?

block.text: <<Nә Müqәddәs Yazıları, nә dә Allahın qüdrәtini bilirsiniz. Yanılmanıza sәbәb bu deyilmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when they will rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.

block.text: İnsanlar ölülәr arasından dirilәndә nә evlәnir, nә dә әrә gedirlәr. Ancaq sәmadakı mәlәklәr kimi olurlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But about the dead, that they are raised; haven't you read in the book of Moses, about the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?

block.text: Bәs ölülәrin dirildiyinә gәlincә, Musanın kitabındakı kolla bağlı әhvalatda Allahın necә ona “Mәn İbrahimin Allahı, İshaqın Allahı vә Yaqubun Allahıyam” dediyini oxumamısınızmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are therefore badly mistaken.”

block.text: Allah ölülәrin deyil, dirilәrin Allahıdır. Belәliklә, siz çox yanılırsınız>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the scribes came, and heard them questioning together. Knowing that he had answered them well, asked him,

block.text: İlahiyyatçılardan biri gәlib onların mübahisәlәrinә qulaq asdı vә İsanın onlara yaxşı cavab verdiyini görüb Ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which commandment is the greatest of all?”

block.text: <<Әmrlәrin әn әsası hansıdır?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: İsa cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The greatest is, ‘Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one:

block.text: <<Әmrlәrin әn әsası budur: “Dinlә, ey İsrail! Allahımız Rәbb yeganә Rәbdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.

block.text: Allahın Rәbbi bütün qәlbinlә, bütün varlığınla, bütün düşüncәnlә vә bütün gücünlә sev”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The second is like this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”

block.text: İkincisi dә budur: “Qonşunu özün kimi sev”. Bunlardan böyük әmr yoxdur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The scribe said to him,

block.text: İlahiyyatçı Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly, teacher, you have said well that he is one, and there is none other but he.

block.text: <<Müәllim, Sәn nә yaxşı dedin, hәqiqәti söylәdin. Allah yeganәdir, Ondan başqası yoxdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”

block.text: Onu bütün qәlbinlә, bütün ağlınla vә bütün gücünlә sevmәk, qonşunu da özün kimi sevmәk yandırma qurbanlarının vә başqa qurbanların hamısından daha vacibdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, he said to him,

block.text: Dәrrakәli cavab verdiyini görәn İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are not far from the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: <<Sәn Allahın Padşahlığından uzaq deyilsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one dared ask him any question after that.

block.text: Bundan sonra heç kim İsadan bir şey soruşmağa cәsarәt etmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus responded, as he taught in the temple,

block.text: İsa mәbәddә tәlim öyrәdәrәk belә sual verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?

block.text: <<Niyә ilahiyyatçılar Mәsih Davudun Oğludur deyirlәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For David himself said in the Holy Spirit, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.” ’

block.text: Davud özü Müqәddәs Ruh vasitәsilә “Rәbb mәnim Ağama dedi: ‹Mәn düşmәnlәrini ayaqlarının altına salanadәk Sağımda otur›” deyib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore David himself calls him Lord, so how can he be his son?”

block.text: Davud özü Ona “Ağa” deyә müraciәt edir. O necә Davudun oğlu ola bilәr?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The common people heard him gladly.

block.text: Böyük izdiham sevinclә Ona qulaq asırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In his teaching he said to them,

block.text: İsa tәlim öyrәdәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Beware of the scribes. They like to walk around in long robes, and to get greetings in the marketplaces.

block.text: <<İlahiyyatçılardan özünüzü qoruyun. Onlar uzun paltarlarda gәzmәyi, bazar meydanlarında salam almağı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They choose the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts.

block.text: Onlar sinaqoq ən yaxşı oturacaqlar və bayramlar ən yaxşı yerlərdə seçin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. They will receive the greater damnation.”

block.text: Onlar dul qadınların evlәrini yeyib-dağıdar vә özlәrini göstәrmәk üçün uzun-uzadı dua edәrlәr. Bu adamların cәzası daha ağır olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus sat down opposite the treasury, and saw how the multitude cast money into the treasury. Many who were rich cast in much.

block.text: İsa mәbәdin ianә qutusunun qarşısında oturub xalqın oraya necә pul atmasına baxırdı. Bir çox varlı adamlar oraya böyük mәblәğdә pul atırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A poor widow came, and she cast in two small copper coins, which equal a penny.

block.text: Bir kasıb dul qadın da gәlib bir kodrant mәblәğindә iki lepton pul atdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called his disciples to himself, and said to them,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәrini yanına çağırıb onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, this poor widow gave more than all those who are giving into the treasury.

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: bu kasıb dul qadın ianә qutusuna hamıdan çox pul atdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all gave out of their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, gave all that she had to live on.”

block.text: Çünki onların hamısı varlarının artıqlığından verdi, bu qadın isә kasıblığına baxmayaraq, dolanmaq üçün әlindә nә varsa, hamısını verdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 13
As he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him,

block.text: İsa mәbәddәn çıxarkәn şagirdlәrindәn biri Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, see what kind of stones and what kind of buildings!”

block.text: <<Müәllim, bax nә gözәl daşlar, nә gözәl binalardır!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone on another, which will not be thrown down.”

block.text: <<Bu böyük binaları görürsәnmi? Onların daşı daş üstündә qalmayacaq, hamısı yerlә yeksan olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked him privately,

block.text: İsa mәbәdlә üzbәüz olan Zeytun dağında oturanda Peter, Yaqub, Yәhya vә Andrey Ondan ayrılıqda soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are all about to be fulfilled?”

block.text: <<Bizә söylә, bu dediklәrin nә vaxt baş verәcәk? Bunların hamısı başa çatmaq üzrә olanda hansı әlamәtlәr olacaq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, answering, began to tell them,

block.text: İsa onlara cavab vermәyә başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be careful that no one leads you astray.

block.text: <<Ehtiyatlı olun, qoy sizi heç kim aldatmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am Christ!’ and will lead many astray.”

block.text: Mәnim adımla çox adam gәlib “mәn Oyam” deyәrәk çoxlarını aldadacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don't be troubled. For those must happen, but the end is not yet.

block.text: Müharibәlәr vә müharibә xәbәrlәri eşidәndә tәlaşa düşmәyin. Bunlar baş vermәlidir, amma bu hәlә hәr şeyin axırı deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These things are the beginning of birth pains.

block.text: Çünki millәt millәtә, padşahlıq padşahlığa qarşı çıxacaq. Yerbәyer zәlzәlәlәr vә aclıq olacaq. Bunlar sanki doğuş ağrılarının başlanğıcıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them.

block.text: Amma siz ehtiyatlı olun. Adamlar sizi mәhkәmәlәrә çәkәcәk, sinaqoqlarda döyәcәklәr. Onlara şәhadәt etmәk üçün siz Mәnә görә valilәrin vә padşahların qarşısında duracaqsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.

block.text: Әvvәlcә bütün millәtlәrә Müjdә vәz olunmalıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they lead you away and deliver you up, don't be anxious beforehand, or premeditate what you will say, but say whatever will be given you in that hour. For it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: Sizi aparıb mәhkәmәyә çәkәndә nә deyәcәyiniz barәdә qabaqcadan qayğı çәkmәyin, amma hәmin vaxt sizә nә bildirilәrsә, onu danışın. Çünki danışan siz yox, Müqәddәs Ruhdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

block.text: Qardaş qardaşı, ata övladını ölümә tәslim edәcәk. Övladlar ata-anasına qarşı çıxıb onları edam etdirәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be hated by all men for my name's sake, but he who endures to the end, the same will be saved.

block.text: Mәnim adıma görә hamı sizә nifrәt edәcәk. Amma axıracan dözәn xilas olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

block.text: Viranәlik gәtirәn iyrәnc şeyin heç olmamalı yerdә qoyulduğunu gördüyünüz zaman – qoy oxuyan bunu anlasın – Yәhudeyada olanlar dağlara qaçsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house.

block.text: Damda olan evindәn nә isә götürmәk üçün aşağı enib evinә girmәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let him who is in the field not return back to take his cloak.

block.text: Tarlada olan üst paltarını götürmәk üçün geri qayıtmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!

block.text: Hәmin günlәr hamilәlәrin vә körpә әmizdirәnlәrin vay halına!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pray that your flight won't be in the winter.

block.text: Dua edin ki, bu hadisә qış fәslindә baş vermәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be.

block.text: Çünki o günlәrdә elә bir әzab-әziyyәt olacaq ki, Allahın yaratdığı bu kainatın başlanğıcından indiyә qәdәr belәsi olmayıb vә heç dә olmayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the sake of the chosen ones, whom he picked out, he shortened the days.

block.text: Әgәr Rәbb o günlәri qısaltmasaydı, heç bir insan xilas ola bilmәzdi. Amma Rәbb seçilmişlәrә – Öz seçdiyi insanlara görә o günlәri qısaldıb.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then if anyone tells you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ don't believe it.

block.text: O zaman әgәr kimsә sizә desә ki, “bax, Mәsih buradadır” yaxud da “bax oradadır”, inanmayın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.

block.text: Çünki yalançı mәsihlәr vә yalançı peyğәmbәrlәr törәyәcәk. Onlar әlamәtlәr vә xariqәlәr göstәrәcәklәr ki, imkan taparlarsa, seçilmişlәri dә aldatsınlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you watch. Behold, I have told you all things beforehand.

block.text: Amma siz ehtiyatlı olun! Bax Mәn sizә hәr şeyi әvvәlcәdәn söylәmişәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,

block.text: Amma o günlәrdә, o әzab-әziyyәtdәn sonra Günәş tutulacaq, Ay nurunu saçmayacaq,

ReferenceBlocks.text: the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.

block.text: Ulduzlar göydәn tökülәcәk, Sәma cisimlәri lәrzәyә gәlәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

block.text: O zaman onlar Bәşәr Oğlunun buludlar içindә böyük qüdrәt vә izzәtlә gәldiyini görәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky.”

block.text: Onda Bәşәr Oğlu mәlәklәrini göndәrәcәk vә yer üzünün ucundan göyün ucuna qәdәr dörd külәk istiqamәtindәn Öz seçdiklәrini toplayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now from the fig tree, learn this parable. When the branch has now become tender, and puts forth its leaves, you know that the summer is near.

block.text: Әncir ağacından ibrәt alın: onun budağı cücәrib yarpaqlananda bilirsiniz ki, yay fәsli artıq yaxındır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also, when you see these things coming to pass, know that it is near, at the doors.

block.text: Elәcә siz dә bu şeylәrin baş verdiyini görәndә bilin ki, Bәşәr Oğlu yaxındadır, lap qapılardadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: bu nәsil ömrünü sona çatdırmazdan әvvәl bütün bunlar baş verәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.

block.text: Yer vә göy keçib gedәcәk, amma Mәnim sözlәrim әsla keçib getmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

block.text: Lakin o günü vә o saatı nә sәmadakı mәlәklәr, nә dә Oğul bilir. Atadan başqa heç kim bilmir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch, keep alert, and pray; for you don't know when the time is.”

block.text: Ehtiyatlı olun, oyaq olun. Çünki bilmirsiniz ki, o an nә vaxt gәlәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is like a man, traveling to another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, and to each one his work, and also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch.

block.text: Bu, sәyahәtә çıxan bir adama bәnzәyir. Evindәn ayrılarkәn qullarına sәlahiyyәt verir vә hәrәsinә bir iş tapşırır. Qapı nәzarәtçisinә dә әmr edir ki, oyaq olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch therefore, for you don't know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;

block.text: Ona görә dә oyaq olun. Çünki ev sahibinin nә vaxt – axşammı, gecә yarısımı, xoruz banlayandamı yaxud sübh tezdәnmi gәlәcәyini bilmirsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: lest coming suddenly he might find you sleeping.

block.text: Qoy o qәfil gәlib sizi yatan görmәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What I tell you, I tell all: Watch.”

block.text: Sizә söylәdiklәrimi hamıya deyirәm, oyaq olun!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 14
It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread, and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might seize him by deception, and kill him.
For they said,

block.text: Pasxa vә Mayasız Çörәk bayramına iki gün qalmışdı. Başçı kahinlәr vә ilahiyyatçılar İsanı hiylә ilә tutub öldürmәk üçün bir yol axtarırdılar.
Onlar deyirdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not during the feast, because there might be a riot of the people.”

block.text: <<Bunu bayramda etmәyәk, yoxsa xalq arasında qarışıqlıq düşәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nard--very costly. She broke the jar, and poured it over his head.

block.text: İsa Bet-Anyada cüzamlı Şimonun evindә süfrәyә oturanda bir qadın Onun yanına gәldi vә qadının әlindә içindә çox bahalı xalis nard yağı olan ağ mәrmәr qab var idi. Qadın qabı sındıraraq yağı İsanın başına tökdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying,

block.text: Bәzilәri acıqlanıb bir-birlәrinә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why has this ointment been wasted?

block.text: <<Bu әtir niyә boş yerә israf olunur?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii, and given to the poor.”

block.text: Axı bu әtiri üç yüz dinardan artıq qiymәtә satıb pulunu yoxsullara vermәk olardı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They grumbled against her.
But Jesus said,

block.text: Onlar qadını danladılar.
Lakin İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for me.

block.text: <<Qadını rahat buraxın. Niyә onu incidirsiniz? O Mәnim üçün gözәl bir iş gördü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to, you can do them good; but you will not always have me.

block.text: Yoxsullar hәmişә sizin yanınızdadır, istәdiyiniz vaxt onlara kömәk edә bilәrsiniz. Mәn isә hәmişә yanınızda olmayacağam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She has done what she could. She has anointed my body beforehand for the burying.

block.text: Qadın bacardığını etdi. Mәnim bәdәnimә dәfn üçün әvvәlcәdәn yağ çәkdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.”

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: dünyanın hansı yerindә Müjdә vәz edilәrsә, bu qadının etdiyi bu iş dә danışılacaq ki, o yada salınsın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went to the chief priests and said:

block.text: Yәhuda İskaryot edən bir on iki idi, üz baş kahinlərə getdi və dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will hand him over to you.”

block.text: "Mən üzərində onu el edəcək."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard this they rejoiced and said:

block.text: O zaman onlar bu onlar razı dedi eşitmişik:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We will pay you for this!”

block.text: "Biz bu üçün verəcəkdir!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He began looking for a convenient time to betray Jesus.

block.text: O da İsanı tәslim etmәk üçün fürsәt axtarmağa başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him,

block.text: Pasxa quzusu qurban kәsildiyi Mayasız Çörәk bayramının ilk günü şagirdlәri İsadan soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where do you want us to go and prepare that you may eat the Passover?”

block.text: <<Sәnin Pasxa yemәyin üçün haraya gedib hazırlıq görmәyimizi istәyirsәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent two of his disciples, and said to them,

block.text: İsa da şagirdlәrindәn ikisini göndәrdi vә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go into the city, and there you will meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him.

block.text: <<Şәhәrә girin, orada qarşınıza sәhәnglә su daşıyan bir nәfәr çıxacaq. Onun ardınca gedin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Wherever he enters in, tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’

block.text: O hansı evә girәrsә, oranın sahibinә deyin: “Müәllim deyir: ‹Şagirdlәrimlә birgә Pasxa yemәyini yeyәcәyim qonaq otağım haradadır?›”

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will himself show you a large upper room furnished and ready. Get ready for us there.”

block.text: Ev sahibi sizә yuxarı mәrtәbәdә döşәnib hazırlanmış böyük bir otaq göstәrәcәk. Orada bizim üçün hazırlıq işlәri görün>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found things as he had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.

block.text: Şagirdlәr yola çıxıb şәhәrә getdilәr. Hәr şeyin Onun dediyi kimi olduğunu gördülәr vә Pasxa yemәyi üçün hazırlıq etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was evening he came with the twelve.
As they sat and were eating, Jesus said,

block.text: Axşam düşәndә İsa On İki şagirdi ilә birlikdә gәldi.
Onlar süfrәyә oturub yemәk yeyәrkәn İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, one of you will betray me--he who eats with me.”

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: sizlәrdәn biri – Mәnimlә yemәk yeyәn biri Mәnә xәyanәt edәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They began to be sorrowful, and to ask him one by one,

block.text: Onlar kәdәrlәnmәyә başladılar vә bir-bir Ondan soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Surely not I?”

block.text: <<Mәn deyilәm ki?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is one of the twelve, he who dips with me in the dish.

block.text: <<Siz On İki nәfәrdәn biridir. Mәnimlә birlikdә çörәyini qaba batıran odur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man goes, even as it is written about him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would be better for that man if he had not been born.”

block.text: Bәşәr Oğlu Özü barәsindә yazıldığı kimi gedir. Amma vay o adamın halına ki, Bәşәr Oğluna xәyanәt edir! O adam heç doğulmasaydı, onun üçün daha yaxşı olardı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had blessed, he broke it, and gave to them, and said,

block.text: Onlar yeyәndә İsa çörәk götürdü, şükür duası edib onu böldü vә şagirdlәrә verәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take and eat. This is my body.”

block.text: <<Alın! Bu Mәnim bәdәnimdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them. They all drank of it.
He said to them,

block.text: Sonra bir kasa götürdü vә şükür edib onu da şagirdlәrә verdi vә hamısı oradan içdi.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many.

block.text: <<Bu, Әhdin bağlanması üçün çoxları uğrunda axıdılan Mәnim qanımdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, I will no more drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it anew in the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: Allahın Padşahlığında tәzәsini içәcәyim günә qәdәr üzüm ağacının mәhsulundan әsla içmәyәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Onlar ilahi oxuyandan sonra çıxdılar vә Zeytun dağına tәrәf getdilәr.
İsa şagirdlәrinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All of you will be made to stumble because of me tonight, for it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’

block.text: <<Hamınız Mәni atıb gedәcәksiniz, çünki belә yazılıb: “Çobanı vuracağam, Qoyunlar pәrәn-pәrәn olacaq”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.”

block.text: Amma Mәn dirilәndәn sonra sizdәn qabaq Qalileyaya gedәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said to him,

block.text: Peter Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Although all will be offended, yet I will not.”

block.text: <<Hamı Sәni atıb getsә dә, mәn belә etmәyәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, that you today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.”

block.text: <<Sәnә doğrusunu deyirәm: bu gün, bu gecә xoruz iki dәfә banlamazdan әvvәl sәn Mәni üç dәfә inkar edәcәksәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he spoke all the more,

block.text: Amma Peter daha qәtiyyәtlә danışdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I must die with you, I will not deny you.”

block.text: <<Әgәr Sәninlә birlikdә ölmәyim lazım olsa belә, Sәni әsla inkar etmәyәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all said the same thing.

block.text: Bütün şagirdlәr dә belә dedilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. He said to his disciples,

block.text: Sonra Getsemani adlanan bir yerә gәldilәr. İsa şagirdlәrinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sit here, while I pray.”

block.text: <<Mәn dua edәrkәn siz burada oturub-qalın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took with him Peter, James, and John, and began to be greatly troubled and distressed.
He said to them,

block.text: O, Peteri, Yaqubu vә Yәhyanı Özü ilә apardı. Özündә bir hәyәcan vә narahatlıq hiss etmәyә başladı.
Onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch.”

block.text: <<Ürәyimi elә dәrin kәdәr bürüyüb, az qalır ki, ölüm. Burada qalın vә oyaq olun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him.
He said,

block.text: İsa bir qәdәr irәli getdi vә üzüstә yerә qapanıb dua etdi ki, mümkündürsә, bu an Ondan yan keçsin.
O belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you. Please remove this cup from me. However, not what I desire, but what you desire.”

block.text: <<Abba – Ata, Sәnin üçün hәr şey mümkündür. Bu kasanı Mәndәn uzaqlaşdır. Amma Mәnim yox, Sәnin iradәn olsun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәrin yanına qayıdıb gördü ki, onlar yatıb. O, Peteri sәslәdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn't you watch one hour?

block.text: <<Şimon, yatmısan? Mәgәr bir saat oyaq qala bilmәzdinmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Watch and pray, that you may not enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”

block.text: Oyaq durub dua edin ki, sınağa düşmәyәsiniz. Ruh hәvәsli, cisim isә gücsüzdür>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he went away, and prayed, saying the same words.

block.text: İsa yenә oradan uzaqlaşdı vә eyni sözlәri tәkrar edәrәk dua etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he returned, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy, and they didn't know what to answer him.

block.text: Qayıdanda gördü ki, onlar yenә yatıb. Çünki onların gözlәri yumulurdu. Bilmәdilәr ki, İsaya nә desinlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came the third time, and said to them,

block.text: İsa üçüncü dәfә onların yanına qayıdıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sleep now and take your rest. It is enough. The hour has come. Behold, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

block.text: <<Hәlә dә yatıb dincәlirsiniz? Bәsdir! Vaxt yetişdi! Budur, Bәşәr Oğlu günahkarların әlinә tәslim olunur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Arise, let us be going. Behold, he who betrays me is at hand.”

block.text: Qalxın gedәk. Budur, Mәnә xәyanәt edәn gәlir!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came--and with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.

block.text: İsa hәlә danışarkәn On İki şagirddәn biri olan Yәhuda gәlib çıxdı. Onun yanında başçı kahinlәrin, ilahiyyatçıların vә ağsaqqalların göndәrdiyi әli qılınclı vә dәyәnәkli bir dәstә adam var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying,

block.text: İsaya xәyanәt edәn Yәhuda onlara işarә ilә bildirib demişdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whomever I will kiss, that is him. Seize him, and lead him away safely.”

block.text: <<Kimi öpsәm, İsa Odur. Onu tutub möhkәm nәzarәt altında aparın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said,

block.text: O anda İsaya yaxınlaşıb

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi! Rabbi!”

block.text: <<Rabbi!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and kissed him.
They laid their hands on him, and seized him.

block.text: deyәrәk Onu öpdü.
Yanındakı adamlar әl atıb İsanı tutdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But a certain one of those who stood by drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and
cut off his ear.
Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsanın yanındakılardan biri qılınc çәkdi vә baş kahinin
qulunu vurub qulağını qopartdı.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to seize me?

block.text: <<Nә üçün quldur üstünә gәlәn kimi qılınc vә dәyәnәklәrlә Mәni tutmağa gәlmisiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you didn't arrest me. But this is so that the Scriptures might be fulfilled.”

block.text: Hәr gün mәbәddә sizin yan-yörәnizdә tәlim verirdim, heç Mәni tutmadınız. Amma qoy Müqәddәs Yazılar yerinә yetsin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all left him, and fled.

block.text: Onda hamı İsanı atıb qaçdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain young man followed him, having a linen cloth thrown around himself, over his naked body. The young men grabbed him,

block.text: Çılpaq bәdәnini kәtan örtüklә bürüyәn bir gәnc İsanın ardınca gedirdi. Әsgәrlәr onu yaxaladılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.

block.text: Amma o, kәtan örtükdәn sıyrılıb çılpaq qaçdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They led Jesus away to the high priest. All the chief priests, the elders, and the scribes came together with him.

block.text: İsanı baş kahinin yanına gәtirdilәr. Başçı kahinlәrin hamısı, ağsaqqallar vә ilahiyyatçılar da oraya toplaşdı.
